resources.string: Which of the statements below best completes this sentence?\n Artificial Intelligence refers to computer systems that:
A. Can mimic human beings in decision making, creativity and perception
B. Can perform complex tasks with higher efficiency than human competitors
C. Can learn as humans do and demonstrate improvement if set to execute the same or similar tasks repeatedly
In the wake of early advances in AI in the 1950s, Allan Turing developed a test to tell \'intelligent\' computer systems and human beings apart. What was the name of the test?
A computer was considered to have passed the above test if:
A. A judge was convinced the computer imitated the human being with an accuracy of at least 65%
B. The computer performed equally as well as or better than the average human player in the traditional Chinese game of Go
C. A person receiving information from both the computer and a human being was unable to differentiate between the two sources on the basis of that information alone
D. A human being judged that the computer system could fool human beings into believing it was sentient (i.e., could feel, perceive, experience subjectively)
Which of the following terms is not associated with Artificial Intelligence?
Which of the following terms describes a type of Artificial Intelligence?
Some of the following terms refer to types of hacking techniques than an attacker might use. [And some don\'t]. Which one does AND is correctly matched with its description?

A. Keylogger : attacker directs a computer system to record input from the keyboard into a log file, including entered logins and passwords. He then studies the log file for logins into a target system
B. Bait and Switch : an attacker fakes a popularly visited site, and sends a link to the fake site to an unsuspecting user. The attacker can then steal any data the user enters at this trojan site

C. Denial of Service (DoS/DDoS) : an attacker infects a computer system with malware that alters the legitimate access credentials to that computer system, thereby denying legitimate users of the system access to it.
D. All the above refer to hacking techniques, and are correctly matched with their definitions
Which of these three mobile phone platforms is the most difficult to hack, and why?

A. Apple iOs ; because it employs industry recommended Pre-Relay Isolated Storage and Serialization techniques, which store all user data only on the device, and must encrypt and serialize all user data before it is sent from the device
B. Microsoft Windows Mobile OS ; because it is the least adopted mobile system of these three
C. Android ; because it has a larger user base, and therefore benefits from a vast research base
Some of the following terms are commonly used in reference to various types of hackers. Which one doesn\'t refer to a type of hacker, OR is incorrectly matched with its description?
A. White Hat Hacker : also called ethical hacker, hacks into computer systems to identify vulnerabilities in the system in order to sensitize the systems\'s owners of such vulnerabilities
B. Black Hat Hacker : exploits vulnerabilities in computer systems illegally for some selfish interest non-beneficial to the owner
C. Hacktivist : subversively uses computer systems to promote a political agenda or social change
D. Grey Hat Hacker : hired by white hat or black hat hackers to identify and exploit vulnerabilities in computer systems
This saddens me so very much :( . I hope you\'re sad too
Not bad. Not bad at all
